greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 3^n mod 5; or period 4, repeat [1, 3, 4, 2].
comment: Residues mod 5 of Lucas numbers: for n>=1, a(n-1) = A000032(n) mod 5. - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 28 2008
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,-1,1).
formula: a(n) = a(n-4) for n>3. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jul 09 2016
mathematica: Table[PowerMod[3, n, 5], {n, 0, 200}] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jun 10 2011 *)
program: (Sage) [power_mod(2,-n,5) for n in range(0, 101)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 08 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 12 2002
